alert.note: Alert for Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 12:54AM EST until January 03 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from earlier heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Ohio, including the following county, Noble. * WHEN...Until 645 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1251 AM EST, Gauge reports indicated creek and stream levels are elevated across the area. Duck Creek is just above flood stage, and should continue to rise through early Sunday morning. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dexter City and Harriettsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
